content:
According to the proximus.be site, the recommended settings are:

incoming IMAP server: imap.proximus.be, port 993, SSL/TLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

outgoing SMTP server: relay.proximus.be, port 587, STARTTLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

Check that you have these in Tools/Account Settings, Server Settings, for the incoming and Outgoing Server (SMTP) for the outgoing.

If you have all that and it still won't send, it might be your antivirus blocking the connection, especially with an app like AVG/Avast, Norton etc.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Did you see this discussion?

The error suggests you're trying to send on an smtp server with no authentication. Most Spectrum smtp servers go through port 587 with STARTTLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address. Check your settings in Account Settings. The fix might be as simple as switching the settings.

Another option might be to add your business account as an authorized sender to a personal gmail account, then set the business account to send on the gmail smtp server.
creator: sfhowes

content: PS. Using a desktop PC with Windows 11 v22H2 x64 with current updates.
